item.title: Air Canada suspends operations as flight attendants go on strike
item.description: More than 10,000 Air Canada flight attendants went on strike after a deadline to reach a deal passed, leaving travelers around the world stranded and scrambling during the peak summer travel season.

item.title: Hurricane Erin becomes a Category 4 in the Caribbean as the region braces for flooding
item.description: Erin strengthened into a powerful Category 4 hurricane in the Caribbean on Saturday and continues to intensify, the National Hurricane Center said.

item.title: As arms race in Asia intensifies, a-bomb survivors make final plea for peace
item.description: While atomic bomb survivors warn the catastrophic risks, leaders of nuclear-armed states and self-proclaimed 'realists' argue that the deterrence of nuclear weapons is what keeps them from being deployed.

item.title: A Secret History of the Japanese Army
item.description: On the 80th anniversary of Japan’s surrender in WWII, the legacy of a biological warfare unit still haunts. And human rights activists are alarmed by the Trump administration’s changing focus.

item.title: Trump and Putin conclude talks on Ukraine touting progress, but no breakthrough
item.description: President Trump said that he and Russia's Vladimir Putin made progress in talks to end the war in Ukraine, but the two leaders did not announce any steps toward reaching a ceasefire.
